evt_r_009_replacement.title: CEO Praise at All-Hands
evt_r_009_replacement.description: The CEO called an unexpected all-hands to publicly recognize the team's recent work. Morale spiked as people felt genuinely appreciated for their contributions.

evt_r_009_replacement.title: Awkward Fireside Chat
evt_r_009_replacement.description: The CEO surprised everyone with an all-hands featuring their college roommate doing a 'fireside chat' about growth hacking tactics from 2015. Team morale declined as an hour was lost to irrelevant platitudes.

evt_r_001_replacement.title: CEO Returns From Conference (Blockchain Phase)
evt_r_001_replacement.description: The CEO attended a tech conference and became convinced that distributed ledger technology is the future. Strategic focus has shifted to whatever 'Web3' means this quarter.

evt_r_001_replacement.title: CEO Returns From Conference (Architecture Confusion Phase)
evt_r_001_replacement.description: The CEO attended a three-day summit and is now certain the company needs to move to microservices. Or possibly to a monolith. They weren't entirely sure which architecture we currently have, but are confident we should be doing the other one.

evt_r_001_replacement.title: CEO Returns From Conference (AI Everything Phase)
evt_r_001_replacement.description: The CEO returned from a conference completely energized about artificial intelligence. Every feature must now have 'AI' in the title regardless of whether machine learning is involved.

evt_r_001_replacement.title: CEO Returns From Conference (Serverless Phase)
evt_r_001_replacement.description: The CEO spent three days listening to keynotes about serverless architecture and cloud-native design. Infrastructure is now the strategic priority and the CTO is experiencing mixed emotions.

5. Total: Remove 2 events, add 6 new events (net +4 events)

rationale.evt_r_009_split: Original event was ambiguous ('either improved or deteriorated'). Split into two clear outcomes based on CEO sentiment: positive when CEO is happy (>60), negative when CEO is stressed (<40). This makes the event predictable and fair.
rationale.evt_r_001_variants: Original event said 'ideas novel in 2019' but didn't specify what happens. New variants are explicit: CEO picks a specific tech trend (blockchain, microservices, AI, serverless) and shifts focus accordingly. Each has clear metric effects and forces appropriate ticket categories.
